msContents.summary:
This is the commentary on the Yajurveda chapter 3. The manuscript is written in kamalāpūra, and the scribe copied or wrote commentary on the second, third, and second half of the fifth chapters of the Yajurveda, according to the colophon, which is only extant in fragments.
A folio with a title and something written in Granth script appeared after the guard folio. The text is : yajurvedatṛtīyakāṇḍasya śamara suvidyāraṇya (folio broken) dharmmamārtaṇḍa … and because of the fractured folio, the back side of the same folio, which bears the title written in Devanagari, is lost in part. Ya[jurvedatṛtīyakāṇḍabhāṣya] . Also the same leaf is written in Granth yajurvedatṛtīyakāṇḍasya.
